contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox CFL player |name=Zeke Moreno |team=Free Agent |image= |ImageWidth= |capshon= |status=Active |import=yes |position1=Linebacker |number= |College=[[University of Southern California|Southern California]] |high_school=[[Castle Park High School|Castle Park]] |birth_date={{Birth date and age|1978|10|8|mf=y}} |birth_place=[[Chula Vista, California]] |Height_ft=6 |Height_in=2 |Wait_lbs=246 |NFLDraftedYear=2001 |NFLDraftedRound=5 |NFLDraftedPick=139 |NFLDraftedTeam=San Diego Chargers |playing_years=2001-2004<br />2005<br />2005<br />{{CFL Year|2007}}-{{CFL Year|2008}}<br />{{CFL Year|2008}}<br />{{CFL Year|2009}}<br /> {{UFL Year|2010}} |playing_teams=[[San Diego Chargers]]<br />[[Houston Texans]]<br />[[Philadelphia Eagles]]<br />[[Hamilton Tiger-Cats]]<br />[[Winnipeg Blue Bombers]]<br />[[Toronto Argonauts]]<br />[[Sacramento Mountain Lions]] |career_highlights= * UFL 2010 Defensive Player Of The (Week 2) |CFLAllStar={{CFL Year|2007}}, {{CFL Year|2008}} |CFLEastAllStar={{CFL Year|2007}}, {{CFL Year|2008}} |Awards= |Honors= |Records= |NFL=MOR119860 |CBS=235126 |DatabaseFootball=MORENZEK01 |CFL=989 }} '''Ezekiel Aaron Moreno''' (born October 8, 1978) is a professional [[American football]] [[linebacker]]. ==Early years== Moreno attended [[Castle Park High School]] in Chula Vista and was a letterman in football and baseball. In football, as a senior, he led his team to a state championship in 1996. It was actually a "mythical" state championship, because the state of California does not have a state championship. ==College career== Moreno played [[college football]] for the [[University of Southern California]]'s defense from 1998-2000. Known as "Zeke And Destroy" by many USC-faithful, Moreno was a force in the middle of the USC defense. ==Professional career== Moreno was [[NFL draft|drafted]] by the [[San Diego Chargers]] in the fifth round (139th pick overall) of the [[2001 NFL Draft]]. He played for the Chargers for four years (2001â€“2004). Moreno was released by the Chargers following the 2004 season and was hampered by injuries while trying to find a home with another team in 2005. He signed with the [[Hamilton Tiger-Cats]] of the [[Canadian Football League]] in 2007. He was selected as a CFL All-Star in 2007 and 2008. On September 9, 2008, Moreno was traded to the [[Winnipeg Blue Bombers]].<ref>[http://www.cbc.ca/sports/football/story/2008/09/08/cfl-bluebombers-tigercats.html Blue Bombers tweak trade for Zeke Moreno]</ref> On February 19, 2009, Moreno was traded to the [[Toronto Argonauts]] in exchange for defensive end [[Riall Johnson]].<ref>[http://www.sportsnet.ca/football/cfl/2009/02/18/argos_moreno/ Argos acquire Moreno from Bombers]</ref> On February 21, 2010, Moreno was released by the Argonauts. ==Records== -most single season tackles by a Hamilton Tiger-Cat (114) ==Personal== He married Christina Hernandez in 2002. They have one son Lorenzo "Zo" Ezekial Moreno. His brother, [[Moses Moreno]], also played in the [[National Football League]] as a [[quarterback]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.argonauts.ca/index.php/roster/show/id/989 Toronto Argonauts bio] {{Chargers2001DraftPicks}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Moreno, Zeke | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American football player | DATE OF BIRTH =October 10, 1978 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Chula Vista, California]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Moreno, Zeke}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American football linebackers]] [[Category:American players of Canadian football]] [[Category:Hamilton Tiger-Cats players]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Chula Vista, California]] [[Category:Philadelphia Eagles players]] [[Category:Sacramento Mountain Lions players]] [[Category:San Diego Chargers players]] [[Category:Toronto Argonauts players]] [[Category:USC Trojans football players]] [[Category:Winnipeg Blue Bombers players]] [[Category:American sportspeople of Latin American descent]]
